Pre-Game Insights: Canada is the overwhelming underdog in the match against Argentina
Canada will enter this match as a team in their first Copa América going up against an Argentina side who have reached this stage in six of the last seven tournaments
This a Canadian team who have shown internal belief with each challenge they have faced and overcome at this competition
Argentina will be at peak intensity as they are only a match away from reaching another Copa América final
Miscellaneous Highlights: Canada and Argentina come into Tuesday’s contest off the back of quarter-final victories on penalty kicks
Canada’s rise at this competition has been perhaps best personified by that of Jacob Shaffelburg
Shaffelburg was a real headache for Argentina in his half-hour cameo off the bench in the tournament opener
Argentina’s Lautauro Martínez has taken the tournament by storm, scoring a competition-leading four goals
Others: The match will take place on July 9, 2024 at 8 p.m. ET/5 p.m. PT at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey
The losing team in both of the semifinals will head to Bank of America Stadium in Charlotte, North Carolina to play in the tournament’s third-place game on Saturday, July 13
The 2024 Copa América final is the next day at Hard Rock Stadium in Miami, Florida on Sunday, July 14
